content.text: During initial planning, the initial quantity of cables should not use more than 40% of the usable crosssectional area within the chosen pathway system subject to the following definition for useable crosssectional area:

a) for uncovered pathway systems and cable management systems (e.g. tray, basket), cables are not  installed above the sidewalls (note electromagnetic screening performance of the selected cable  management system may require modified criteria - see Clause 6);
b) bends in the pathway systems may restrict the useable space dependent upon the specified bend radii  of the cable to be installed;

c) for non-enclosed pathway systems to which cables are to be attached or supported by (e.g.  suspension/catenary wires or designated routes) then the cross-sectional area shall be considered to be  the minimum available area surrounding the pathway system.
